2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (11:54): if i want to develop a embedded application (like a player) for a dvd firmware using qtopia, can i use for example xine-lib and qt?
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (11:56): and embed the video window into a qtopia application
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:58): asdx: perhaps, some kde media players use xine
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:58): kaffeine for instance, and codeine too, i think
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:58): some use mplayer, like kmplayer
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (11:59): i think it's harder to integrate
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:01): i always wanted to do some linux firmware for a dvd player using linux, qtopia looks perfectly for that
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:03): yeah, qtopia could be nice for that

2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:03): it would be nice if you can make a fullscreen window and put the video there in fullscreen too, and make a translucent window on top of that with the control for play/pause/prev/next, etc
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:04): and control the video with that
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:04): probably that can be done
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:05): i think it can be doen
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:05): otherwise qtopia would be kinda, well, useless
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:05): and with using mplayer or xine-lib you are giving the user a plenty of video and audio formats available
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:05): there is an archos running qtopia
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:06): osd is not that easy...
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:06): you mean the osd is bad or that it's hard to code?
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:07): pgas: osd is what you use for put gui controls on the video right
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:08): or you need to do soft blitting on the video ..which might be slow
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:09): there are some X extension and the like...but no easy tutorial
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:11): what does qtopia embedded devices uses for display. X?
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:12): currently named qtopia core I think
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:14): i thought they used directfb or something like that :P
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:16): they implement qt over a basic graphic layer, qtopia is the wm/desktop environement
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:17): I guess you could port qt/e to  directfb
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:17): oh, but qtopia runs in X? or it has it's own graphic system?
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:18): qtopia is a kind of X replacement
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:18): directfb? it's been a few years since i last heard of that one :)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:19): i've done some small apps with it, it was quite fun stuff at the time
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:20): yeah i remember they had already compositing and all that by that time
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): simple games, graphics tests etc
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): me too, but i suck at it :)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:20): but i like playing with QGraphicsView
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:21): which is at the far other end of the spectrum
d166c00706088a1723ca6ed2590378eb (12:21): asdx: there is a #qtopia channel also
2909df86d8d914f61dea394637cf2022 (12:21): chakie_work: i'll take a look at that
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:22): QGV isn't really for embedded stuff
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:22): it's in 4.2 only (which is not yet released, only an rc is available)
e5c246c422bf5aeed2dab4c68c680e2b (12:24): i think it's too heavy for an embedded device
